alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:55PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of , the southern City of Norfolk, the northwestern City of Chesapeake, the City of Portsmouth and the eastern City of Suffolk through 645 PM EDT... At 555 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Downtown Portsmouth to near Suffolk. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Old Dominion University, Downtown Norfolk, Downtown Suffolk, Deep Creek, Downtown Portsmouth, Churchland, Norfolk State University, Virginia Wesleyan University, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Driver, Ghent, Bowers Hill, Cradock, Western Branch, South Norfolk, Portlock and Suffolk Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
